Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:75 yr old male presents with 2 months history of moderate abdominal pain. patient reports moderate nausea. o:Height 191 cm, Weight 104.5 kg, Temperature 37.1 C, Pulse 83, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 72, Respiration 16, eyes = dilated pupil, Abdomen = non tender, non distended, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Nausea p:performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed prochlorperazine - 25 mg daily (rectal dose), and ordered CT Abdomen.

s:pt complains of moderate abdominal pain and moderate nausea. NKDA. he is a 76 yo male. he has approx. a 30 pack/year history of smoking denies any alcohol use o:Height 191 cm, Weight 102.6 kg, Temperature 37 C, Pulse 85, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 15, eyes = dilated pupil, Abdomen = non tender, non distended, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Nausea p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed prochlorperazine - 25 mg daily (rectal dose), and ordered CT Abdomen.
